update.description:
This pull request enables the `visibility_range` comms model type. If for some reason the `visibility_range` is selected but the required files are not present \( `.dot`and `.dat` files\), the plugin will automatically use `log_normal_range` as a fallback.

How do I test it?

* At this moment, we don't have the `.dot` and `.dat` files for the `virtual_stix` world, so we'll need to use `tunnel_qual_ign` for testing. Edit the file `subt_ign/launch/virtual_stix.ign` and replace `worldName = 'virtual_stix'` with `worldName = 'tunnel_qual_ign'`
* We need to exercise some communication between the robots. I created some testing controllers for this purpose. Edit the file `subt_ign/launch/team.ign` and uncomment the following two blocks at the end of the file:

```
<!-- Testing comms in X1 -->
<!-- <plugin entity_name="X1"
             entity_type="model"
             name="subt::ControllerPlugin"
             filename="libControllerPlugin.so">
  <name>X1</name>
</plugin> -->

<!-- Testing comms in X2 -->
<!-- <plugin entity_name="X2"
             entity_type="model"
             name="subt::ControllerPlugin"
             filename="libControllerPlugin.so">
  <name>X2</name>
</plugin> -->
```

* Recompile, and launch the world with:

```
ign launch virtual_stix.ign -v 4
```

* And in a separate terminal run:

```
ign launch team.ign -v 4
```

You should observe the following messages in the first terminal showing that the messages are actually received between X1 and X2:

```
[Msg] X1 controller loaded
[Msg] X2 controller loaded
[Msg] [X2] Msg sent
[Msg] [X1] Message received from [X2]: [hello from X2]
[Msg] [X1] Msg sent
[Msg] [X2] Message received from [X1]: [hello from X1]
[Msg] [X2] Msg sent
[Msg] [X1] Message received from [X2]: [hello from X2]
```

content.raw: World names now end in `.sdf` instead of `.world`. This PR seems to work, so I'm not sure this variable affects anything.
content.html: World names now end in .sdf instead of .world. This PR seems to work, so I'm not sure this variable affects anything.

content.raw: Are the file deletions and additions just moving files around?
content.html: Are the file deletions and additions just moving files around?

update.description:
This pull request enables the `visibility_range` comms model type. If for some reason the `visibility_range` is selected but the required files are not present \( `.dot`and `.dat` files\), the plugin will automatically use `log_normal_range` as a fallback.

How do I test it?

* At this moment, we don't have the `.dot` and `.dat` files for the `virtual_stix` world, so we'll need to use `tunnel_qual_ign` for testing. Edit the file `subt_ign/launch/virtual_stix.ign` and replace `worldName = 'virtual_stix'` with `worldName = 'tunnel_qual_ign'`
* We need to exercise some communication between the robots. I created some testing controllers for this purpose. Edit the file `subt_ign/launch/team.ign` and uncomment the following two blocks at the end of the file:

```

<!-- <plugin entity_name="X1"
             entity_type="model"
             name="subt::ControllerPlugin"
             filename="libControllerPlugin.so">
  <name>X1</name>
</plugin> -->

<!-- Testing comms in X2 -->
<!-- <plugin entity_name="X2"
             entity_type="model"
             name="subt::ControllerPlugin"
             filename="libControllerPlugin.so">
  <name>X2</name>
</plugin> -->
```

* Recompile, and launch the world with:

* And in a separate terminal run:
